de.topicmapslab.tmql4j.components.parser
Class ParserTreeImpl

java.lang.Object
  de.topicmapslab.tmql4j.components.parser.ParserTreeImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
IParserTree
Direct Known Subclasses:
TmqlParserTree, TmqlParserTree
public abstract class ParserTreeImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements IParserTree

Base implementation of a IParserTree. The parser tree is a tree-structured representation of the origin query. Each node of the tree represent exactly one production rule of the current TMQL draft. A node can have a non-quantified number of children representing the current node in the aggregate. Nodes of the same level never overlapping and cannot contain the same tokens at the same time.

Author:
Sven Krosse

Returns:
the created expression and never null

root

public IExpression root()
Method returns the IExpression representing the root node of the generated parsing tree. The expression has to be of type query-expression and the result of calling the method IExpression.getParent() has to be null.

Specified by:
root in interface IParserTree
Returns:
the root node

Specified by:

Parameters:

treeNodeToString

private void treeNodeToString(IExpression expression,
                              boolean[] hasBrothers,
                              java.lang.StringBuilder builder)
Internal method to transform a tree node ( IExpression ) to a representative string. The string representation contains the name of the production rule and a list of contained lexical tokens.

Parameters:
expression - the expression representing the tree node
hasBrothers - a array representing the upper-hierarchy. If the expression at the specific level has brothers the array contains true at this position, false otherwise.
builder - the string builder where the generated string will be written in

arrayCopy

private boolean[] arrayCopy(boolean[] array)
Internal utility method to copy all values of the given array to a new instance and add a new empty field at the end of the new array. The length of the new array will be the same like the origin one extended by one.

Parameters:
array - the array to copy
Returns:
the new array
